intro: Schismatoglottis ardenii, commonly known as the Arden's schismatoglottis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Schismatoglottis ardenii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
